alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northwest Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 2:08PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A BAND OF SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHWEST SUFFOLK... NORTHWEST SUFFOLK...SOUTHEAST SUFFOLK...AND NORTHEAST SUFFOLK COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of snow showers which can reduce visibility to a mile or less at times. The precipitation may start as rain before changing over. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 206 PM EST, a band of snow showers was along a line extending from near Rocky Point to near Robert Moses State Park and moving east at 50 MPH. THIS BAND OF SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE NEAR... Medford and Patchogue around 210 PM EST. Shirley and Wading River around 215 PM EST. Manorville and Center Moriches around 220 PM EST. Riverhead and Mattituck around 230 PM EST. Southold and Peconic around 235 PM EST. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Northwest Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk
